@exps35 wrote:

Niall:

[quote author=exps35 link=topic=279237.msg2273677#msg2273677 date=1213352118]They also spell color wierd, but its just how they do things around there.

spell color wierd, but its just how they do things

wierd[/quote]

Yea, I realized that yesterday when I was quoted. I felt like such a douche, but realized there was no point in changing it since it was forever engraved in a few posts below.

Read full topic

item.title: Jagex Can't Spell
item.dc:creator: @Gromit Gromit
item.description:
@Gromit wrote:

[quote=“IP-Drowner, post:18, topic:211994”][quote author=exps35 link=topic=279237.msg2273677#msg2273677 date=1213352118]
They’re brits, what can you say?

They also spell color wierd, but its just how they do things around there.
[/quote]
Colour was the original language. Remember that English secondly came to U.S.A and conquered it, hence the English language, and it was called America because of the previous colony that lived there (the Spaniards). After about 400 years or so, the American population didn’t want to be under British control, so they rebelled against the British and had won. They didn’t want to be kept like the British, so they changed the spelling in some words, as they didn’t want to change the language because that would be too complicated for the population.

So remember, the Americans have their way of spelling things, while us Australians and British have their way of spelling things too. Always remember that above fact when doing history ;)[/quote]

Not quite right, the differences in the spelling are because the English language as spoken by the English was not standardised until the seventeen hundreds while American English was standardised nearly a century later with America being declared an independent country in between.

Damb, I love wikipedia

Read full topic

spell color wierd, but its just how they do things

wierd[/quote]

Touché.

The British way of doing it is right, and it always will be.

item.title: Jagex Can't Spell
item.dc:creator: @IP-Drowner IP-Drowner
item.description:
@IP-Drowner wrote:

[quote=“exps35, post:5, topic:211994”]They’re brits, what can you say?

They also spell color wierd, but its just how they do things around there.[/quote]
Colour was the original language. Remember that English secondly came to U.S.A and conquered it, hence the English language, and it was called America because of the previous colony that lived there (the Spaniards). After about 400 years or so, the American population didn’t want to be under British control, so they rebelled against the British and had won. They didn’t want to be kept like the British, so they changed the spelling in some words, as they didn’t want to change the language because that would be too complicated for the population.

So remember, the Americans have their way of spelling things, while us Australians and British have their way of spelling things too. Always remember that above fact when doing history

Read full topic
